tp1.sentence: After viewing a television news story about the discovery, centenarian Rose Dawson Calvert contacts Lovett, identifying herself as the woman in the drawing.

tp2.sentence: Rose brings Jack to her state room and requests he draw her nude, wearing only the Heart of the Ocean.

tp3.sentence: With the ship sinking, the crew prioritize women and children for evacuation.

tp4.sentence: Cal grabs Lovejoy's pistol and chases Jack and Rose, but they escape.

tp5.sentence: In the freezing water, Jack helps Rose onto a wood transom panel among the debris, buoyant enough only for one person, and makes her promise to survive.

tp1.sentence: He pursues her and they begin a romance.

tp2.sentence: The next morning, Anne announces they will be returning home to Charleston immediately.

tp5.sentence: Upon recovering and despite not being permitted, Duke sneaks into Allie's room in the night.

tp1.sentence: Juli adores an old sycamore tree in their neighborhood, so when one day they start to cut it down she tries to protect it by climbing it, refusing to come down.

tp2.sentence: As Chet spends more time with Juli and encourages Bryce to open his mind, Bryce realizes he has feelings for her.

tp3.sentence: Afterwards, Juli apologizes to Bryce for her behavior, and he realizes she feels completely indifferent to him, leaving him confused and hurt.

tp4.sentence: Overwhelmed with jealousy, he gets up and tries to kiss her in front of everyone, but she runs off, humiliated.

tp5.sentence: Two days later, with Richard's permission, Bryce plants a sapling sycamore tree in their front yard to show her how he truly feels.

tp1.sentence: Delayed, Mark asks his friend—a handsome Egyptian named Tareq—to watch over Juliette.

tp2.sentence: Tareq is a regular (but not constant) companion during Juliette's extended time waiting for Mark, leading to a very close relationship between the two.

tp3.sentence: After travelling to Alexandria with him to attend the wedding of the daughter (Hanan) of a girlfriend from his university days (Yasmeen), she admits that she will miss him when she returns to Canada.

tp4.sentence: Whatever change this may signify in Tareq and Juliette's growing relationship, they return to the hotel to find that Mark has finally arrived.

tp5.sentence: Mark is happy to see Juliette, while she and Tareq adequately hide their sorrow over the end of their Cairo Time.

tp1.sentence: Bingley and Jane are immediately taken with each other, while Elizabeth instantly dislikes the snobbish Darcy and overhears his dismissive remarks about her.

tp2.sentence: He wins Elizabeth's sympathy by claiming Mr. Darcy denied him his rightful inheritance.

tp3.sentence: Distraught, Elizabeth is then met by Darcy, who surprisingly proposes marriage, declaring his ardent love despite her inferior rank.

tp4.sentence: An urgent letter from Jane reveals that Lydia has run off with Wickham. Darcy leaves abruptly, and Elizabeth returns home, certain she will never see Darcy again.

tp5.sentence: He professes his continued love and Elizabeth, her feelings radically altered, accepts his proposal.

tp1.sentence: She begins keeping a diary to chronicle her attempts to stop smoking, stop drinking, lose weight, and find her Mr. Right.

tp2.sentence: Bridget cuts ties with him and immediately searches for a new career.

tp3.sentence: Bridget begins to develop feelings for Mark, and when she misguidedly and somewhat disastrously, attempts to cook her own birthday dinner party, he comes to her rescue.

tp4.sentence: At the Darcys' ruby wedding anniversary party the same day, Bridget confesses her feelings for Mark, only to learn that he and Natasha have accepted jobs in New York and are on the verge of an engagement, according to Mark's father.

tp5.sentence: Bridget's friends rally to repair her broken heart with a surprise trip to Paris, but as they are about to leave, Mark appears at Bridget's flat.

tp1.sentence: At an engagement party the next day at Ashley's home, Twelve Oaks, a nearby plantation, Scarlett makes an advance on Ashley but is rebuffed; however, she catches the attention of another guest, Rhett Butler.

tp2.sentence: With Tara pillaged by Union troops and the fields untended, Scarlett vows to ensure her and her family's survival.

tp3.sentence: Shortly after Frank's funeral, Rhett proposes to Scarlett, and she accepts.

tp4.sentence: Rhett kisses Scarlett against her will, stating his intent to have sex with her that night, and carries the struggling Scarlett to the bedroom.

tp5.sentence: Having realized that it was Rhett, and not Ashley that she truly loved all along, Scarlett pleads with Rhett to stay, but he rebuffs her and walks away into the morning fog.

tp1.sentence: The taxi is T-boned, and Samantha dies.

tp2.sentence: Ian feels happy to have Samantha by his side.

tp3.sentence: A sudden shower sends them into an isolated hut.

tp4.sentence: As the clock strikes 11, the taxi (again) meets with a sideways collision.

tp5.sentence: This time, however, Samantha was hurt but survived, while Ian is the victim.

tp1.sentence: Seth soon becomes focused on Maggie and becomes visible to her.

tp2.sentence: Seth begins to consider being with Maggie, and she learns that he is an angel.

tp3.sentence: Seth becomes human by jumping from the top of a skyscraper.

tp5.sentence: She tells him she is not afraid anymore and that when they ask her what her favorite thing in life was, she will say it was Seth, and she then dies.

tp1.sentence: It is here where he meets Vivian Ward, a prostitute.

tp2.sentence: The following day, Edward asks Vivian to pose as his girlfriend during a week-long series of business events he must attend while attempting a takeover of James Morse's shipbuilding company.

tp4.sentence: As Edward's return to New York draws near, he offers to help Vivian get off the streets by suggesting that he put her up in a nice condo and provide her with an allowance.

tp5.sentence: This rejection prompts Edward to re-evaluate his life, and while being driven to the airport, he asks the chauffeur to detour to Vivian's apartment building.

tp1.sentence: When Kate's sister Christine is killed in a car accident, her nine-year-old niece, Zoe, must move in with her.

tp5.sentence: In the end, Kate allows herself to become vulnerable and tear down the walls she has built throughout her life so that she and Nick could start fresh.

tp4.sentence: She proclaims that she loves him, and pleads to rekindle their relationship.

tp1.sentence: While having lunch in Daley Plaza on Valentine’s Day, 2006, Kate witnesses a man get hit by a car and tries but fails to save him.

tp3.sentence: Heartbroken, Kate ends their relationship and stops visiting the lake house to settle for a future with Morgan.

tp4.sentence: Realizing Alex was the man she failed to save at Daley Plaza, Kate rushes to the lake house herself and writes a frantic message to Alex begging him to wait two years and find her at the lake house.

tp5.sentence: At the lake house, Kate is distraught with grief that she failed to save Alex and collapses to her knees at the mailbox.

tp1.sentence: The countess is snubbed at one social party arranged by her family, but with the help of Archer she is able to make a comeback at an event being hosted by the wealthy Van der Luydens.

tp1.sentence: Bullied because of his leg braces and dimwittedness, Forrest flees from a group of children, but when his braces break off, he is revealed to be a fast runner.

tp2.sentence: Soon afterwards, Forrest and Bubba are sent to fight in Vietnam, serving with the 9th Infantry Division in the Mekong Delta region under Lieutenant Dan Taylor.

tp3.sentence: He uses the earnings to buy a shrimping boat in Bayou La Batre, fulfilling his promise to Bubba.

tp5.sentence: Jenny then introduces him to her young son, Forrest Gump Jr., revealing that Forrest is his father.

tp1.sentence: She is removed from the home and placed into the care system as her father cannot take care of her.

tp4.sentence: After Jean dies of AIDS, which she contracted from sharing needles during her drug-abusing years, Liz gets a slap in the face by her mother's death and begins her work to finish high school, which she amazingly completed in two years, rather than the usual four.

tp1.sentence: At the end of the concert, which Brad's Tourette's tics had disturbed, he calls Brad up to the stage and asks Brad to talk about his condition.

tp2.sentence: From that moment on, Brad aspires to become a teacher, just like the principal.

tp3.sentence: He is turned down after 24 interviews because of his Tourette syndrome, and finally gets an interview where the staff is accepting and they give him the job.

tp5.sentence: An observer at the school assesses Brad's teaching, and the head teacher announces that Brad has been chosen to receive the Teacher of the Year award, which he accepts in front of his family, friends and students.

tp1.sentence: When Professor Gerald Lambeau posts a difficult combinatorial mathematics problem on a blackboard as a challenge for his graduate students, Will solves the problem anonymously, stunning both the students and Lambeau.

tp5.sentence: Sean helps Will see that he is a victim of his own inner demons and to accept that it is not his fault, causing him to break down in tears in Sean's arms.

tp1.sentence: Christy's father, who never believed Christy would amount to anything, starts to become proud after witnessing him use his left foot, the only body part he can fully control, to write the word mother on the floor with a piece of chalk.

tp1.sentence: Dismayed at the prospect of the students losing their chances at scholarships, Yoast changes his mind and accepts Boone's offer to serve as his defensive coordinator.

tp4.sentence: That night, while celebrating the victory, Gerry is severely injured in a car accident and is paralyzed from the waist down.

tp1.sentence: In the wake of the tragedy, University President Donald Dedmon leans towards indefinitely suspending the football program, but he is ultimately persuaded to reconsider by the pleas of the Marshall students and Huntington residents, and especially the few football players who didn't make the flight, led by Nate Ruffin.

tp2.sentence: Dedmon returns victorious.

tp3.sentence: The new team is composed mostly of the 18 returning players (three varsity, 15 sophomores) and walk-on athletes from other Marshall sports programs.

tp4.sentence: Due to their lack of experience, the Young Thundering Herd ends up losing its first game, 29–6, to the Morehead State Eagles.

tp5.sentence: The Herd's first post-crash victory is a 15–13 win against Xavier University in the first home game of the season.

tp1.sentence: Bertie, as he is called by his family, believes the first session is not going well, but Lionel, who insists that all his patients address him as such, has his potential client recite Hamlet's To be, or not to be soliloquy while hearing classical music played on a pair of headphones.

tp5.sentence: He delivers his speech with Logue conducting him, but by the end he is speaking freely.

tp1.sentence: Andy plans to put up with Miranda's excessive demands and humiliating treatment for one year in the hopes of getting a job as a reporter or writer somewhere else.

tp1.sentence: In 1949, Andy overhears the captain of the guards, Byron Hadley, complaining about being taxed on an inheritance and offers to help him shelter the money legally.

tp1.sentence: Ed takes pity on Erin, and she gets a paid job at the office.

tp2.sentence: Erin begins digging into the case and finds evidence that the groundwater in Hinkley is seriously contaminated with carcinogenic hexavalent chromium, but PG&E has been telling Hinkley residents that they use a safer form of chromium.

tp3.sentence: Knowing that PG&E could slow any settlement for years through delays and appeals, Ed takes the opportunity to arrange for disposition by binding arbitration, but a large majority of the plaintiffs must agree to this.

tp5.sentence: The judge orders PG&E to pay a settlement amount of $333 million to be distributed among the plaintiffs.

tp1.sentence: On the first day of classes, the boys are surprised by the unorthodox teaching methods of new English teacher, John Keating.

tp1.sentence: During his college years, Truman, though written to fall in love with and marry fellow student Meryl, develops feelings for Sylvia, an extra.

tp3.sentence: One day, Truman takes Meryl on a surprise road trip in an attempt to leave Seahaven Island. Increasingly implausible disasters block their way.

tp1.sentence: While attending a game between the Springboks, the country's rugby union team, and England, Mandela recognises that some black people in the stadium are cheering for England, and not their own country, as the mostly-white Springboks represent prejudice and apartheid in their minds; he remarks that he did the same while imprisoned on Robben Island.

tp2.sentence: Knowing that South Africa is set to host the 1995 Rugby World Cup in one year's time, Mandela persuades a meeting of the newly black-dominated South African Sports Committee to support the Springboks.

tp3.sentence: Things begin to change as the players interact with the fans and begin a friendship with them.

tp4.sentence: Meanwhile one day during the tournament, the Springbok team visited Robben Island, where Mandela spent the first 18 of his 27 years in jail.

tp5.sentence: The Springboks complete their run by beating the All Blacks 15–12 in extra time, thanks to a drop goal from fly-half Joel Stransky.

tp1.sentence: After Dan is forced to fire several of his longtime colleagues, he is demoted and becomes the “wingman” of his new boss, Carter Duryea, a 26-year-old business school prodigy.

tp2.sentence: Carter, who has been struggling with loneliness following the breakup of his marriage, invites himself to dinner at Dan's, where he meets Alex, and there is an immediate attraction.

tp3.sentence: However, the relationship takes a turn for the worse when Dan discovers that Carter and Alex have been seeing each other.

tp4.sentence: Following another corporate shakeup, Sports America is sold off, Carter is let go, and Dan returns to his former position as head of sales.

tp5.sentence: Having developed fatherly feelings towards Carter, Dan offers him a position in his new department as his “wingman”, but he declines, saying he needs to take some time and discover what he really wants to do in his life.

tp1.sentence: Edward’s life is told through flashbacks, beginning with his encounter with a witch in his hometown, Ashton.

tp2.sentence: Returning to his reminisces, Edward reunites with Karl and they visit the Calloway Circus, where Edward falls in love with a beautiful woman.

tp3.sentence: Upon returning home, Edward becomes a traveling salesman and crosses paths with Winslow, unwittingly helping him rob a failing bank, inspiring the poet to work on Wall Street.

tp4.sentence: In the present, Will investigates the truth behind his father’s tales and travels to Spectre.

tp5.sentence: Though struggling, Will tells his father of their imagined daring escape from the hospital to the nearby lake, where everyone from Edward’s past is there to see him off.

tp1.sentence: Distraught by her stepfamily's mistreatment of her, Ella rides off into the woods.

tp2.sentence: However, they rip her dress and leave her behind.

tp3.sentence: She magically transforms a pumpkin into a carriage, mice into horses, lizards into footmen, and a goose into the coachman.

tp4.sentence: Ella hurries to retrieve the slipper to prove her identity, but Lady Tremaine finds it first.

tp5.sentence: Ella successfully tries on the slipper and, as she leaves with Kit, forgives her stepmother.

tp1.sentence: Jealous, Olga's daughters Hattie and Olive find out about Ella's obedience and use it to humiliate her.

tp2.sentence: Ella learns that Lucinda is in Giantville so she leaves to find her.

tp3.sentence: Edgar learns of Ella's gift from her stepsisters. Knowing his nephew is in love with her, he orders Ella to murder Char at midnight and to keep this plan secret.

tp4.sentence: As she is about to stab him, she sees her reflection along with a vision from her late mother and tearfully commands herself to no longer be obedient, permanently freeing herself from the gift.

tp5.sentence: As Char and Ella fight off the guards, she confesses her love for him and reveals Edgar's plot.

tp1.sentence: After school, they venture into the woods and swing across a creek on a rope.

tp2.sentence: Leslie gives Jess an art kit on his birthday.

tp3.sentence: Jess and Leslie take P.T. to Terabithia, where they fight off the Dark Master's creatures resembling their bullies, this time with the troll as their ally.

tp4.sentence: When Jess returns home, his family is revealed to be distraught not only because they didn't know where he was but it's also revealed that Leslie died after hitting her head in the creek when the rope she used snapped.

tp5.sentence: Jess decides to re-imagine Terabithia and builds a bridge across the river to welcome a new ruler.

tp1.sentence: He accidentally breaks one of her glass figurines and is able to carve a new one out of wood, which surprises her father Richard.

tp2.sentence: About two decades after being awoken, Andrew presents Richard with all the money he has made to ask for his freedom.

tp3.sentence: Andrew agrees to fund Rupert's work and to be a test subject and is soon given a human-like appearance.

tp4.sentence: Andrew petitions the World Congress to recognize him as a human as to allow him to marry Portia, but the body expresses concern that an immortal human will cause jealousy from others.

tp5.sentence: On April 2, 2205, with Andrew's body deteriorating, he and Portia are both under life support monitored by Galatea, now with a human appearance.

tp1.sentence: In Madison, New Jersey, David, a prototype Mecha child capable of experiencing love, is given to Henry Swinton and his wife Monica, whose son Martin contracted a rare disease and has been placed in suspended animation.

tp2.sentence: After Martin is unexpectedly cured of his disease and brought home, he jealously goads David into cutting off a piece of Monica's hair.

tp3.sentence: Henry convinces Monica to return David to his creators for destruction, believing David is capable of love and hate.

tp4.sentence: Disheartened by his lost sense of individuality, David attempts suicide by falling from a skyscraper into the ocean.

tp5.sentence: However, they recreate Monica through genetic material from the strand of hair that Teddy kept.

tp1.sentence: Later that night, Elliott returns with a flashlight, discovering the creature among the cornstalks.

tp2.sentence: Despite his family's disbelief, Elliott leaves a trail of candy to lure the alien into his house.

tp3.sentence: E.T. gets Elliott's help to build a device to "phone home" by using a Speak & Spell, along with a record player, circular-saw blade, wooden coat-hanger, foil-lined umbrella, and other items from around Elliott's house.

tp4.sentence: Elliott returns home to his worried family. Michael discovers E.T. dying next to a culvert and takes him home to an also-dying Elliott.

tp5.sentence: E.T. reanimates and tells Elliott that his people are returning.

tp1.sentence: However, prot is unwavering in his ability to provide cogent answers to questions about himself, K-PAX, and its civilizations.

tp2.sentence: prot also wins over the other patients at the Institute, each of whom believes unquestioningly that he is indeed from K-PAX.

tp3.sentence: Upon learning that many of his patients expect to leave Earth on July 27, Powell confronts prot, who explains that it is a predetermined date.

tp4.sentence: Powell tries to confront prot with this knowledge, showing him a photo of Robert Porter in a high school yearbook and stating that it is in fact prot himself; but prot's reaction is one of bemusement, and he cryptically tells Powell that he hopes he will take good care of Robert now that he has found him.

tp5.sentence: In a final voiceover, prot explains to Powell that the people of K-PAX have discovered that our universe will repeat its events again and again, so the mistakes we make will be repeated forever.

tp1.sentence: One evening after a dust storm, Cooper discovers a gravitational anomaly in Murph's bedroom, creating patterns of falling particles.

tp2.sentence: NASA has been publicly shut down, but continues to run in secret.

tp3.sentence: The Endurance spacecraft leads three other NASA scientists - Romilly, Doyle and Brand's daughter Amelia, as well as two intelligent robots, TARS and CASE, past the wormhole and to the orbit of the first planet.

tp4.sentence: Brand confesses the equation is unsolvable, only created to give hope to humanity that they are not doomed to perish.

tp5.sentence: Having guided Murph to her objective, the tesseract dissolves, ejecting Cooper and TARS back out through the wormhole and to Saturn's orbit, where they are picked up by a present-day (22nd century CE) space-faring O'Neill cylinder.

tp1.sentence: Learning that his father is friends with Dr. Curt Connors, a scientist at Oscorp in the field of cross-species genetics, Peter sneaks into Oscorp, where he is bitten by a genetically modified spider.

tp2.sentence: Peter finds the missing piece to Connors' experiments in his father's papers - the "decay rate algorithm".

tp3.sentence: Peter uses his new abilities to track down criminals matching the killer's description.

tp4.sentence: Connors turns into a violent humanoid reptile while trying to intercept Ratha and attacks people on the Williamsburg Bridge.

tp5.sentence: Gwen creates an antidote, which Peter disperses, restoring Connors and his victims back to normal, but not before the Lizard fatally wounds Captain Stacy.

tp1.sentence: To gain approval from his demanding father, Bartleby creates a fake college, the South Harmon Institute of Technology (SHIT).

tp2.sentence: Their plan backfires when the website, which automatically accepts any applicant, enrolls hundreds of other rejects.

tp3.sentence: After a visit to Harmon disenchants him with traditional college life, he decides to let the students create their own curriculum; this ranges from the culinary arts, sculpting, meditation, to unusual courses such as psychokinesis, a subject one eccentric student wishes to study.

tp4.sentence: Hoyt exposes South Harmon as a fake institution through Sherman, who is attempting to join Hoyt's fraternity as a legacy but is constantly humiliated and abused by them.

tp5.sentence: At the subsequent State of Ohio educational accreditation hearing, Bartleby makes an impassioned speech about the failures of conventional education and the importance seeking knowledge and personal growth through following one's own passions, convincing the board to grant his school a one-year probationary accreditation to test his new system and make the school adequate, thus foiling Van Horne's schemes.

tp1.sentence: After months of studying, Elle scores a 179 on the Law School Admission Test[6] and, combined with her 4.0 GPA, is accepted to Harvard Law School.

tp2.sentence: Later, Elle tells Warner that she intends to apply for one of her professor's internships, but he tells her that she is wasting her time as she is not intelligent enough.

tp3.sentence: The following semester, Professor Callahan, the school's most respected teacher, decides to take on some first-year interns to help with a high-profile case.

tp4.sentence: One night, Callahan tries seducing Elle, who now believes that is why she got the internship.

tp5.sentence: Elle begins to cross-examine Brooke's stepdaughter, Chutney, and catches her in a lie when she discovers significant inconsistencies in her story:

tp1.sentence: En route, Curt sees a beautiful blonde woman driving a white Ford Thunderbird next to them, who mouths "I love you" before turning a right.

tp2.sentence: After leaving the hop, he is coerced into joining a group of greasers called "The Pharaohs", who force him into several tasks including stealing coins from arcade machines and hooking a chain to a police car, ripping out its back axle.

tp3.sentence: While he and Debbie leave Steve's car in a rural spot in order to share a romantic interlude, thieves steal the car.

tp4.sentence: During his night of goading anyone he comes across for a challenge, he picks up an emotional Laurie after the argument with Steve that was brewing all night.

tp5.sentence: As Terry starts the drag race, John takes the lead but Bob's tire blows out, swerving into a ditch and rolling over before bursting into flames.

tp1.sentence: At her first class, Katherine discovers her students have memorized the entire textbook and syllabus, so she introduces them to modern art and encourages discussion about what is good art.

tp2.sentence: Other editorials attack Katherine for advocating that women seek a career instead of being wives and mothers.

tp3.sentence: Giselle Levy has several lovers and liberal views about sex.

tp4.sentence: The relationship progresses, but when Katherine learns that Bill spent the entire war at the Army Languages Center on Long Island, she breaks up with him.

tp5.sentence: Katherine decides to leave to explore Europe.

tp1.sentence: When Cady is invited to sit with the Plastics at lunch, Janis persuades her to infiltrate them.

tp2.sentence: Feeling betrayed, Cady fully commits to Janis' plan to ruin Regina's reputation.

tp3.sentence: Cady informs Aaron that Regina is cheating on him, prompting them to break up, and tricks Regina into eating nutrition bars that Cady purports to be weight-losing, but which in reality cause her to gain weight.

tp4.sentence: Realizing Cady's betrayal, Regina retaliates by distributing the contents of the Burn Book throughout school, inciting chaos among the girls of the junior class.

tp5.sentence: The Plastics disband at the beginning of the new school year; Regina joins the lacrosse team to direct her anger profitably, Karen becomes the school weather reporter, and Gretchen joins the "Cool Asians" clique.

tp1.sentence: Desperate for any kind of connection, he soon invites Mrs. Robinson to the Taft Hotel, where he registers under the pseudonym "Mr. Gladstone".

tp2.sentence: However, Benjamin's parents and Mr. Robinson, unaware of the affair, are eager for Benjamin to date Elaine and relentlessly pester him to ask her out.

tp3.sentence: To prevent Benjamin from dating Elaine, Mrs. Robinson threatens to tell Elaine about their affair.

tp4.sentence: Later, an angry Mr. Robinson arrives at Berkeley and confronts Benjamin in his boardinghouse room, where he informs him that he and his wife will be divorcing soon, and threatens to have Benjamin locked up in prison if he continues to see Elaine.

tp5.sentence: Benjamin runs to the church, arriving just as the ceremony is ending.

tp1.sentence: At the university's activities fair, now-seniors Aubrey and Chloe Bale are attempting to recruit new members for the Bellas, but find interest in their group has decreased significantly after the on-stage incident the previous year.

tp2.sentence: Later, Chloe corners Beca after hearing her sing in the shower and convinces her to audition.

tp3.sentence: She sings a rendition of "Cups (When I'm Gone)", earning herself a place in the Bellas alongside fellow newcomers: the tough Cynthia Rose Adams, the flirtatious Stacie Conrad, the unusually quiet Lilly Onakuramara, the bubbly Jessica Smith, the alto Ashley Jones, the comedic Patricia "Fat Amy" Hobart, and the meek Denise. Meanwhile, Jesse joins the Treblemakers.

tp4.sentence: The crowd does appear to respond to this change, but Aubrey angrily berates Beca for this and ends up accusing her of hooking up with Jesse— a rule breach punishable by ejection from the Bellas.

tp5.sentence: At the Finals, the Bellas perform a modern piece arranged by Beca, which includes "Don't You (Forget About Me)", featured in The Breakfast Club, one of Jesse's favorite movies.

tp1.sentence: One day, Tom unexpectedly receives an offer from his old friend and football teammate Shake McGuire to coach at his alma mater in his hometown of Evanston, Illinois.

tp2.sentence: The atmosphere at the Bakers' new house is tense and the situation at school is even worse.

tp3.sentence: After Kate departs for her book tour, Tom realizes that he cannot handle the children on his own after a chaotic night.

tp4.sentence: Kate overhears from the children about the chaos and cancels the book tour to take charge of the situation.

tp5.sentence: Mark runs away from home, prompting the Bakers to find him.

tp1.sentence: However, when he shares the news with his wife Joanna, he discovers that she is leaving him and their son Billy.

tp2.sentence: Nevertheless, they eventually learn to cope and form a strong connection.

tp3.sentence: Fifteen months later, Joanna returns from California to claim custody of Billy, leading to a contentious legal battle.

tp4.sentence: Ted's job loss and Billy's accident are also used to discredit him.

tp5.sentence: Ted eventually decides not to contest custody.

tp1.sentence: After discovering the parallels between their respective family situations, they show one another a photograph of their parents and realize that they are twins who were separated at birth.

tp2.sentence: Much to Annie’s dismay, she learns that Nick is engaged to Meredith Blake, a 26-year-old publicist from San Francisco who only wants to marry Nick for his fortune.

tp3.sentence: After telling Elizabeth the truth, the two decide to travel to California to establish joint custody of the twins between each parent.

tp4.sentence: Finally seeing Meredith's true nature, Nick breaks up with her.

tp5.sentence: Nick says that he did not want to make the same mistake of not going after Elizabeth again, and they share a kiss.

tp1.sentence: While they are shopping, a man approaches Henry and makes them take him home to look after him.

tp2.sentence: Adele and Frank fall in love and plan to escape to Canada with Henry, packing the car and cleaning out the house.

tp3.sentence: The morning they are going to leave, Henry takes a note to his father's house and leaves it in his mailbox.

tp4.sentence: Before Adele, Frank, and Henry can escape, they hear police sirens approaching.

tp5.sentence: Frank returns to Adele and they embrace.

tp1.sentence: Outside, Jack tries to help Cash, to which he responds by asking Jack if anything is missing from his life.

tp2.sentence: On Christmas Day, Jack wakes up in a suburban New Jersey bedroom with Kate and two children.

tp3.sentence: Taking advantage of a chance meeting when his former boss, chairman Peter Lassiter, comes in to have a tire blowout fixed, Jack uses his business savvy to impress Lassiter, who invites Jack to his office, where Jack worked in his 'other' life.

tp4.sentence: Having decided that he now likes this 'other' life, Jack again sees Cash, now a store clerk.

tp5.sentence: Jack forgoes closing the acquisition deal to intercept Kate, finding her moving out of a luxury townhouse before flying to Paris.

tp1.sentence: During P.E., Greg and his best friend, Rowley Jefferson, escape from a game of Gladiator and notice a moldy piece of cheese on the basketball court. Their friend, Chirag Gupta, tells them that whoever touches it, becomes an outcast, known as “the Cheese Touch”, and that the only way to get rid of it is to pass it on to someone else by touching them.

tp2.sentence: Greg states his intention of becoming the most popular student in school, as well as earning a place in the school yearbook as a class favorite, only for several of his attempts to fail.

tp3.sentence: The boys join Safety Patrol in an effort to become popular and try out for a contest that offers a student a chance to become the cartoonist for the school paper.

tp4.sentence: Greg attempts to pursue popularity without Rowley, but those efforts also fail.

tp5.sentence: They flee the scene when the school's P.E. teacher, Coach Malone, arrives, but when the other kids come back out and notice the cheese has been eaten, Greg takes the blame to save Rowley's reputation, mending their friendship.

tp1.sentence: When Greg returns home, a local talent show is advertised on TV, and Rodrick sees it as the big break for his band, Löded Diper.

tp2.sentence: As punishment, Susan, Greg's father Frank, and younger brother Manny go on a trip to the water park, Rockin’ Rapids, without Greg and Rodrick, leaving them home for the weekend to work on their differences; they are instructed not to invite anyone over.

tp3.sentence: They find that someone wrote: "Rodrick Rules" on the bathroom door in permanent marker.

tp4.sentence: One night, when Frank plans to show a slideshow of his civil war figurines to Susan's editors, who are visiting the Heffley household, he ends up finding pictures of Rodrick's party.

tp5.sentence: Having witnessed the entire conflict and feeling sorry for Rodrick, Greg strikes a deal with Susan that he will stand in as Rowley's assistant if she lets Rodrick perform, which she agrees to.

tp1.sentence: Frank notes that Greg is about to enter eighth grade and considers signing him up.

tp2.sentence: Rowley invites Greg to the local country club. Initially reluctant, he joins Rowley as a guest after learning that his crush, Holly Hills, teaches tennis there.

tp3.sentence: Greg is sent home early, and Frank starts to believe that Rowley is a bad influence.

tp4.sentence: Shortly after, Rodrick reveals to him that a Spag Union disc has been mailed to them, to his horror.

tp5.sentence: At Heather's sweet sixteen a few days later, Löded Diper performs a heavy metal cover of "Baby" with Rodrick on lead vocals to try to impress her.

tp1.sentence: Disheartened, Po returns home, where he meets Li Shan, a panda that both quickly realize is Po's biological father, who came to find Po after receiving a sign from the universe that his son was alive.

tp2.sentence: Li offers to take Po to the village to learn chi and defeat Kai, while Shifu and the Five prepare to protect the Valley.

tp3.sentence: When Po demands that Li teach him how to use chi immediately, Li confesses that he lied about knowing chi out of fear of losing his son again.

tp4.sentence: Realizing this, Po finally admits to Tigress that he cannot defeat Kai and his army alone.

tp5.sentence: In the Mortal Realm, Li, recognizing that finding one's true self is the key to unlocking chi, leads the others to give their chi to Po.

tp1.sentence: Later, Mrs. Otterton visits Chief Bogo's office, pleading for someone to find her husband Emmitt, one of fourteen missing predators.

tp2.sentence: Upon interrogation, Manchas explains that, prior to attacking him, Emmitt yelled about "Night Howlers".

tp3.sentence: At City Hall, Bellwether offers Judy and Nick access to Zootopia's traffic cameras.

tp4.sentence: Wracked with guilt, Judy quits her job and returns to Bunnyburrow.

tp5.sentence: Judy reveals that she had replaced the darts with blueberries and had recorded Bellwether's confession.

tp1.sentence: Her father stops to explore an abandoned amusement park despite Chihiro's protests.

tp2.sentence: After Chihiro tries to help but inadvertently causes some disruption, Kamaji asks a worker named Lin to send Chihiro to Yubaba, the witch who runs the bathhouse.

tp3.sentence: Haku explains that Yubaba controls people by taking their names; if she completely forgets hers like he once did, she will never be able to leave the spirit world.

tp4.sentence: Sen feeds Haku part of the emetic dumpling, causing him to vomit up a seal he stole, saving him from its deadly curse.

tp5.sentence: When they arrive, Sen passes Yubaba's test to identify her parents, and she is allowed to leave.

tp1.sentence: Mr. Fox, now a newspaper columnist, moves the family into a better home inside a tree, ignoring the warnings of his lawyer Clive Badger about how dangerous the area is for foxes due to its proximity to facilities run by three farmers: Walt Boggis, Nate Bunce, and Frank Bean.

tp2.sentence: Angered by the raids, the farmers decide to kill Mr. Fox.

tp3.sentence: The group encounters Badger and many other local animal residents whose homes the farmers have also destroyed.

tp4.sentence: Discovering that Mr. Fox has stolen their goods, the farmers and the fire chief flood the animals' tunnel network with some of Bean's cider, forcing the animals to retreat to the sewers.

tp5.sentence: As the farmers wait for the animals to come out of the manhole, the animals settle into their new homes in the sewers, inviting any other animals to join them.

tp1.sentence: Ten years later, just before Harry's eleventh birthday, owls begin delivering letters addressed to him.

tp2.sentence: At King's Cross station, Harry boards the Hogwarts Express train, and meets fellow students Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger during the journey.

tp3.sentence: While returning to the Gryffindor common room, the staircases change paths, leading Harry, Ron and Hermione to the third floor, which is forbidden to students.

tp4.sentence: After overcoming the barriers, Harry encounters Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher Quirinus Quirrell, who wants the stone;

tp5.sentence: Harry recovers in the school infirmary. Dumbledore tells him the stone has been destroyed to prevent misuse, and that Ron and Hermione are safe.

tp1.sentence: In Diagon Alley, Harry, the Weasleys and Hermione Granger notice a book-signing by Gilderoy Lockhart, Hogwarts' new Defence Against the Dark Arts teacher.

tp2.sentence: In detention, Harry hears a strange voice and later finds caretaker Argus Filch's cat, Mrs Norris, petrified beside a message written in blood: "The Chamber of Secrets has been opened, enemies of the heir... beware."

tp3.sentence: In the Forbidden Forest, Harry and Ron meet Hagrid's giant pet spider, Aragog, who reveals Hagrid's innocence and provides a small clue of the Chamber's monster.

tp4.sentence: However, because he seized Ron's broken wand, the spell backfires, erasing Lockhart's memory and causing a cave-in that separates Harry from Ron and Lockhart.

tp5.sentence: Despite his injury, Harry stabs the diary with the basilisk fang, destroying Riddle and reviving Ginny.

tp1.sentence: Reuniting with his best friends Ron Weasley and Hermione Granger, Harry learns that Sirius Black, a convicted supporter of Lord Voldemort, has escaped Azkaban Prison and intends to kill him.

tp2.sentence: Returning to Gryffindor Tower, the students find the Fat Lady's portrait has been attacked, and the terrified Fat Lady warns Dumbledore that Black entered the castle.

tp3.sentence: Determined to ward off the Dementors, Harry convinces Lupin to teach him the Patronus Charm.

tp4.sentence: Turning Pettigrew back into human form, the group head back to the castle, intending to both expose Pettigrew as the true criminal and exonerate Sirius, but the full moon causes Lupin to transform and Pettigrew escapes.

tp5.sentence: Learning that Black has been captured and sentenced to the Dementor's Kiss, Harry and Hermione act on Dumbledore's advice and use Hermione's Time-Turner, which she was given to attend several classes at once, to go three hours back in time.

tp1.sentence: At Hogwarts, Professor Dumbledore announces that the school will host the Triwizard Tournament along with the Durmstrang Institute from central Europe and the Beauxbatons Academy from France.

tp2.sentence: The Goblet of Fire then selects Harry as the fourth Champion, causing much confusion.

tp3.sentence: Harry later finds the lifeless body of Barty Crouch Sr., a Ministry of Magic official, in the Forbidden Forest.

tp4.sentence: Voldemort attempts to use the Killing Curse on Harry but the latter deflects it – the ghosts of Voldemort's previous victims appear, distracting Voldemort long enough for Harry to use the Cup to return to Hogwarts with Cedric's body.

tp5.sentence: Harry is dragged by Moody to his office – he learns that Moody entered him into the Tournament and was guiding him to ensure the return of Voldemort.

tp1.sentence: Minister for Magic Cornelius Fudge has appointed Dolores Umbridge as Hogwarts new Defence Against the Dark Arts professor.

tp2.sentence: As Umbridge gains more control over the school, Ron and Hermione help Harry form "Dumbledore's Army", a secret group to teach students defensive spells.

tp3.sentence: Umbridge becomes the new Headmistress.

tp4.sentence: Harry, Hermione, Ron, Luna, Neville and Ginny fly to the Ministry of Magic on Thestrals to save Sirius.

tp5.sentence: Voldemort appears, but moments before he can kill Harry, Dumbledore arrives.

tp1.sentence: In Diagon Alley, they see Draco and Narcissa Malfoy, and follow them into Knockturn Alley.

tp2.sentence: Harry discovers that his used Potions textbook is filled with helpful notes and spells added by the "Half-Blood Prince".

tp3.sentence: At Hogwarts, Dumbledore asks Harry to retrieve Slughorn's memory of a young Voldemort.

tp4.sentence: In Hagrid's hut, Harry uses his Liquid Luck potion to convince the reluctant Slughorn to surrender the memory Dumbledore needs.

tp5.sentence: As Harry hides, Draco appears and disarms the headmaster, revealing Voldemort chose him to kill Dumbledore.

tp1.sentence: During preparations for Bill Weasley and Fleur Delacour's wedding, the new Minister for Magic Rufus Scrimgeour arrives.

tp2.sentence: News arrives during the wedding that the Ministry has fallen and Scrimgeour is dead.

tp3.sentence: The trio decide to start their journey to discover and destroy all of Lord Voldemort's Horcruxes, starting from the locket.

tp4.sentence: They destroy the locket Horcrux with the sword.

tp5.sentence: At Malfoy Manor, Bellatrix Lestrange sees a Snatcher has Gryffindor's sword that she believed was in her Gringotts vault.

tp1.sentence: Harry also realises a Horcrux connected to Rowena Ravenclaw is hidden at Hogwarts.

tp2.sentence: Luna Lovegood urges Harry to speak to Helena Ravenclaw's ghost.

tp3.sentence: In the boathouse, the trio overhear Voldemort telling Snape that the Elder Wand cannot serve Voldemort until Snape dies; Nagini then viciously attacks Snape.

tp4.sentence: Dumbledore's spirit meets him and explains that Harry is now free of Voldemort, and can choose to return to his body or move on. Harry chooses the former.

tp5.sentence: Harry finally destroys Voldemort after the Expelliarmus charm deflects the Killing Curse, rebounding it onto the Dark Lord. After the battle, Harry explains to Ron and Hermione that Voldemort never commanded the Elder Wand.

tp1.sentence: Years later, Samuel returns from Harvard University with his fiancée, Susannah.

tp2.sentence: The brothers find themselves in the 10th Battalion, CEF.

tp3.sentence: Tristan returns home, where Susannah finds him weeping over Samuel's grave.

tp4.sentence: Susannah marries Alfred, now a congressman.

tp5.sentence: The remaining O'Banion brother, along with the sheriff and another police officer, come after Tristan.

tp1.sentence: During the drill, the captain notices that the vessel is being followed by Somali pirates in two skiffs, and Phillips calls for help.

tp2.sentence: Despite the efforts of Phillips and his crew, the pirates secure their ladder to the ship.

tp3.sentence: Once all are on the lifeboat, Muse motions for Najee to strike Phillips in the back, forcing him into the vessel before the pirates launch the boat with all five of them on board.

tp4.sentence: The negotiators are unable to change his mind, and a team from DEVGRU parachutes in to intervene, while Phillips attempts to escape from the lifeboat before being quickly recaptured and beaten and choked by Najee and pistol-whipped by Muse.

tp5.sentence: This gives the marksmen three clear shots, by which they simultaneously shoot all three pirates: all three slump down, blood splattering Phillips.

tp1.sentence: Parker Wilson, a professor who commutes to Providence, Rhode Island, finds a dog lost on the railway station in Bedridge and temporarily takes it home.

tp2.sentence: Years later, a grown-up Hachi digs under the fence and follows Parker to the station.

tp3.sentence: However, one morning, Hachi behaves strangely at home and then follows Parker to the railway station with the ball.

tp4.sentence: Hours later, while still holding the ball, Parker suffers a fatal stroke in his classroom and collapses; Hachi waits for him at the railway station.

tp5.sentence: Hachi later passes away at his place in the station, while still waiting for Parker.

tp1.sentence: He becomes a refugee and is forced to live at the airport.

tp2.sentence: Dixon becomes determined to get Viktor out of the airport and make him someone else's problem.

tp3.sentence: After he impulsively remodels a wall in the renovation zone, he is hired by an airport contractor and paid under the table.

tp4.sentence: After nine months, Viktor's friends awaken Viktor with the news that the war in Krakozhia has ended, and he can get a green stamp, allowing him to leave the airport.

tp5.sentence: The delay gives Viktor enough time to get into the city.

tp1.sentence: A baby boy is found abandoned in the first class dining room of the four stacker ocean liner SS Virginian.

tp2.sentence: 1900 shows a particular gift for music and eventually grows up, joining the ship's orchestra.

tp3.sentence: His reputation as a pianist is so renowned that Jelly Roll Morton, of New Orleans jazz fame, comes aboard to challenge him to a piano duel.

tp4.sentence: When he hears the recording, 1900 takes the master disc, offended at the prospect of anyone hearing the music without him having performed it live.

tp5.sentence: Max and 1900 finally meet again and 1900 is irremovable about sinking with the ship, being daunted by the immenseness of the world.

tp1.sentence: Jordan befriends his neighbor Donnie Azoff, and the two start their own boiler room styled brokerage company.

tp2.sentence: Soon after, the company becomes immensely successful, moving out of the auto repair shop into a bigger office.

tp3.sentence: In 1993, Jordan illegally makes $22 million in three hours after securing the IPO of Donnie's childhood friend and shoe designer Steve Madden.

tp4.sentence: After their rescue, the plane sent to take them to Geneva is destroyed when a seagull flies into the engine; Jordan takes this as a sign from God to address his worsening drug addiction and attempts to sober up.

tp5.sentence: In a cocaine-fueled rage, Jordan hits Naomi and tries to drive away with his daughter but crashes his car in the driveway.

tp1.sentence: His current girlfriend, Sherry, is ending their relationship and moving out of his house when a letter in a pink envelope arrives.

tp2.sentence: Initially, Don does not intend to do anything about it, but his busybody neighbor Winston, who is a mystery novel enthusiast, urges Don to investigate.

tp3.sentence: Ultimately Don meets with four women (the fifth one had died before the events of the film), each encounter worse than the last and each woman damaged in some way:

tp4.sentence: Later, Don stops at a florist to buy flowers from a young woman named Sun Green who treats his cut. Don leaves the flowers at the grave of the fifth woman, Michelle Pepe.

tp5.sentence: Don then meets a young man in the street whom he suspects may be his son.

tp1.sentence: One day, Frank discovers that his mother is having an affair with Jack Barnes, his father's friend from the Rotary Club of New Rochelle.

tp2.sentence: He impersonates a Pan Am pilot named Frank Taylor and forges the airline's payroll checks. Soon, his forgeries are worth millions of dollars.

tp3.sentence: Later, in 1967, Carl tracks down Frank in his mother's hometown of Montrichard, France and convinces him to finally surrender to the French police.

tp4.sentence: Frank surrenders to Carl and is sentenced to 12 years in a maximum-security prison.

tp5.sentence: One weekend, Frank prepares to impersonate a pilot again and is intercepted by Carl, who is willing to let him continue with his con, assuring him that no one is chasing him and that it's his choice.

tp1.sentence: Doolittle informs Rafe that he has been accepted into the Eagle Squadron (an RAF outfit for American pilots during the Battle of Britain).

tp2.sentence: During a mission to intercept a Luftwaffe bombing raid, Rafe is shot down over the English Channel and is presumed killed in action.

tp3.sentence: Next morning, on December 7, the Imperial Japanese Navy begins its attack on Pearl Harbor.

tp4.sentence: Danny and Rafe are both promoted to captain and awarded the Silver Star for their actions at Pearl Harbor, and Doolittle asks them to volunteer for a secret mission.

tp5.sentence: A gunfight ensues between the raiders and Japanese ground troops, and Danny is mortally wounded shielding Rafe before the group are rescued by Chinese soldiers.

tp1.sentence: After Fletcher misses Max's birthday party when senior partner Miranda lures him to get promoted by having sex in the office, Max makes a birthday wish for Fletcher to be unable to lie for a single day.

tp2.sentence: Fletcher soon discovers, through a series of embarrassing incidents, that he is unable to lie, mislead, or withhold the truth, to the point that his body physically resists the effort to write a false statement.

tp3.sentence: Fletcher tries desperately to delay the case, even beating himself up in the bathroom, but is unable to lie his way into a continuance.

tp4.sentence: Greta learns of this and, having realized that Fletcher turned over a new leaf, pays his bail.

tp5.sentence: After throwing one of his shoes at the plane's windshield, he is able to get the plane to stop, but is injured after he crashes the mobile stairway and gets thrown off.

tp1.sentence: Meanwhile, Inspector Clouseau is reassigned from his task as a parking officer by Chief Inspector Dreyfus to join the detectives in Japan, where the Tornado's latest heist occurred.

tp2.sentence: Avellaneda lacks a characteristic bullet wound the Tornado received years ago, so the detectives leave.

tp3.sentence: Meanwhile, the Tornado steals the Pope's ring, souring public opinion against the Dream Team.

tp4.sentence: Examining a key found in the Pope's Chambers, the Dream Team match the dead man's DNA with the one recovered from when the Tornado was shot and believe they have solved the case. However, Clouseau remains unconvinced.

tp5.sentence: Finally cornered, Sonia threatens to destroy the diamond and, goaded by Clouseau, she does.

tp1.sentence: However, she is horrified to be met at the door by Mark's wife Kate (Leslie Mann), whom she had assumed to be Mark's housekeeper.

tp2.sentence: Confronting Carly about this, they argue before realizing that Mark is seeing a third woman as both Carly and Kate have been refusing sex with him.

tp3.sentence: All three women decide to get revenge on him together.

tp4.sentence: The women's camaraderie begins to fall apart when Kate finds herself still in love with Mark after caving in and having sex with him.

tp5.sentence: With Carly as her attorney, Kate presents divorce papers and a list of their assets.

tp1.sentence: During a dance routine at a school basketball game, Lester becomes infatuated with Jane's friend, Angela.

tp2.sentence: Lester is informed by his supervisor that he is to be laid off; Lester blackmails him into giving him an indulgent severance package and starts working at a drive-through restaurant.

tp3.sentence: Lester discovers Carolyn's infidelity when she and Kane order a meal at Lester's restaurant but reacts with smug satisfaction.

tp4.sentence: Frank tentatively approaches Lester, then breaks down and tearfully embraces him.

tp5.sentence: Angela goes to the bathroom as Lester smiles at a family photograph, when an unseen figure shoots Lester in the back of the head at point-blank range.

tp1.sentence: After the party, Albert asks Will for Eva's number and, although hesitant since she is not physically attracted to him, Eva agrees to go on a date with Albert, which goes well.

tp2.sentence: Eva finds herself growing fonder of Albert and they have lunch with his teenage daughter, Tess, who, like Eva's daughter Ellen, is graduating from high school and moving away to attend college.

tp3.sentence: Tess then arrives at the house and Eva's suspicions are confirmed.

tp4.sentence: At another appointment with Marianne, Eva is exposed when Albert arrives to drop Tess off.

tp5.sentence: A few months later, on Thanksgiving Day, Eva drives by Albert's home and stops in front of the house on her way to pick up Ellen from the airport.

tp1.sentence: He is hired as a lobby boy supervised by Monsieur Gustave H., the hotel's concierge.

tp2.sentence: There, her attorney, Deputy Vilmos Kovacs, announces a recent codicil which bequeaths famous Renaissance painting Boy with Apple to Gustave.

tp3.sentence: After a testimony by Madame D.'s butler Serge X, Gustave is arrested by Inspector Alfred J. Henckels for Madame D.'s murder; Serge then goes into hiding.

tp4.sentence: When Zero and Gustave are reunited, they set out to prove Gustave's innocence with the assistance of a fraternity of concierges known as the Society of the Crossed Keys, which locates Serge and facilitates a meeting between him, Gustave and Zero.

tp5.sentence: At the back of the painting, Agatha finds Madame D.'s second will, making Gustave the hotel owner.
